summary: When federally funded research leads to inventions, there are certain conditions under which the funding agency can exercise "march-in rights." March-in rights permit a funding agency to allow a third party to license the invention. In 2023, the National Institute of Standards and Technology released draft guidance proposing that the government could consider the price of a product when deciding whether to use march-in rights...
title: Intellectual Property: Information on Draft Guidance to Assert Government Rights Based on Price
